fields.description:
Mike:

On the extranet, view a blog post, click "attachments", then click "edit". It goes to editpage.action instead of editblogpost.action (when viewing attachments) - causing a ClassCAstException:

java.lang.ClassCastException
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.EditPageAction.doDefault(EditPageAction.java:142)

(We should probably check in there anyway and handle it a little more nicely than a CCE - maybe just a standard error)
fields.summary: Clickr plugin: ClassCastException changing tabs from attachments to edit on a blog post.

fields.description: The import should log a warning, and otherwise ignore the unassociated properties in the import XML.
fields.summary: Space import fails on content properties without associated content

fields.description: Filed as a bug because usually the space key is processed in a case-insensitive manner, so at the very least this is inconsistent. I believe space keys in Confluence are unique no matter the case, so it's only reasonable to expect that they should be referrable in a case insensitive manner in any macro as well.
fields.summary: livesearch macro spaceKey parameter value is case sensitive

fields.description: I can successfully add a mail account using IMAP in our wiki space that connects to our corporate Exchange server for mail archiving. But if that username has multiple mailboxes, I can only fetch the default one. I think IMAP supports a format of something like /DOMAIN/username/mailbox but there doesn't seem to be anywhere to specify the mailbox (or domain) when setting up a mail account. What we have is a shared mailbox that multiple people can access. It isn't the default mailbox for anyone. Any ideas how to set this up?
fields.summary: Support for multiple mailboxes with IMAP

fields.description:
Received from customer

RTF Editor - Two bulleted sections with blank lines between them lose the blank lines when page is re-edited.

    * This happens immediately after save, blank lines are lost on first rendering after save
    * Workaround: Using wikitext editing, put    on one of the blank lines
fields.summary: Blank line between bullets is lost

fields.description:
from a customer message.

H3 style in wysywig on several lines can not be turned back into paragraph text style by selecting several lines and selecting paragraph

    * Workarounds
          o Go to wikimarkup tab
          o Put curor in each line individually and select paragraph style
fields.summary: clearing heading formats in bulk doesn't work

fields.description:
This can be seen in the signature block, ie name(new line) position...
Below is from a customer email

Editor frequently makes a mess out of cut and pasted email messages.  Wikimarkup says two adjacent lines of text get concatenated into one line. When cutting and pasting into the wysywig editor, it shows things correctly formatted as multiple lines with proper line breaks. Even the preview shows the line breaks properly. But after save, everything runs together.
fields.summary: Cut and paste of email into rich text editor loses line breaks
Autosave feature not available when creating templates

fields.description:
This was received from a customer

 Navigate Backward Editing Loss - It's sometimes possible during editing with certain key strokes (IBM laptops like T42 have extra forward and backward buttons on the keyboard next to cursor keys) to cause the browser to navigate backwards from the editing page. This causes loss of the current page contents. Navigating browser forward causes browser refresh, and gets an offer to resume editing, which gets the last draft saved. This saves everything except the most recent changes

    * Two changes to Confluence could fix this
          o Disallow backward navigation via a popup "Are you sure?"
          o Don't page refresh on going forward to edit page
fields.summary: suggestions to fix back button losing data on exit

fields.description:
We use the Dynamic Task List macro intensively ...
Some spaces have Anonymous Read Access ...
Anonymous users can edit, ie. update&remove&add&etc. tasks within a page.
This is rather nasty ;-)
fields.summary: Anonymous users can edit dynamic task lists

fields.description:
By default, the {contentbylabel} macro only displays the first five matches that it finds. This confuses _everyone_ who tries to use it.

If there are un-seen results, there should be a "showing first 5 of 120 pages" text by the list.

It may also be a good idea to add a (show all...) link which causes the page to be reloaded with a request parameter that causes the macro to display all results, but this might be expensive if there are a lot of pages (you'd want paging to kick in, which just gets nasty). Maybe if there's more than 100 pages, we should do (show first 100...) instead of (show all...)?
fields.summary: Make the fact that {contentbylabel} truncates results more explicit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7326].
  {panel}

Attachment folders are named according to the project key. Under Windows, some folder names are illegal, preventing attachment folders being created.

The following will all cause errors and cannot be created:
PRN, AUX, CLOCK$, NUL, COM1, COM2, COM3, COM4, COM5, COM6, COM7, COM8, COM9, CON, LPT1, LPT2, LPT3, LPT4, LPT5, LPT6, LPT7, LPT8, and LPT9

full list is from http://www.eggheaven2000.com/detailed/1088.html and comes via Damian Fawkner: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-7935
fields.summary: Certain Project keys make illegal attachment folder names under Windows
Export space configuration in space export

fields.description:
Exporting the CODEGEIST space on confluence.atlassian.com includes the excerpts for all the protected pages which consitute the Codegeist 2006 archive. These pages are protected not with individual page permissions, but by a view restriction on the parent page.

Content properties for non-visible content should not be included in the space export.
fields.summary: Space export includes content properties for content protected by page permissions

fields.description:
Although they're not outwardly visible as far as I can tell, the excerpts and other content properties associated with a page are not deleted when the page itself is deleted.

Keeping this stale data around is bad.
fields.summary: Content properties not removed when associated content is deleted

fields.description:
The jiraissues macros on confluence.atlassian.com and the Extranet aren't showing icons or timestamps correctly.

This could possibly be because JIRA changes their XML format slightly in 3.7, or it could be a bug in the macro.
fields.summary: Jiraissues macro doesn't show icons or timestamps

fields.description: Users who post news and pages to their personal spaces may not be aware that comments are disabled. It would be appropriate to have comments enabled for all users with view permission to the personal space by default.
fields.summary: Comments should be enabled by default for personal spaces

fields.description:
Greetings,

  In our company (where i hear that confluence might be used..), I see lot of potential if hierarchical label maintenance and surfing is possible..

  e.g., I would like to tag a page with labels a-b-c and d-e

  I should be able to see the page when looking for a-b or a-b-c

  Also, allow surfing for pages containing 2 or more labels like a+b

Cheers, Kishore.

ps: I have implemented these features at http://www.namastenetizen.com
fields.summary: allow hierarchical label maintenance and surfing AND surfing for a+b

fields.description: If you click on "Remove Space" then try to click on "Cancel", the space is still removed
fields.summary: Cannot cancel space removal

fields.description:
When using a special characters while labeling a pages (ěščřžýá), this character is incorrectly interpreted while naming HTML files with page content. The links from parent document to these files is not working then.

I would like to ask changing the naming convetion for exported HTML pages (e.g. page#####.html) or providing an option to set it in this way to prevent this issue.
fields.summary: Exported HTML spaces are not working correctly when titles of pages includes a regional character (ěščřž)

fields.description:
If Confluence spaces includes a link to external file/java script, this file is not included in daily backup.
I would like to ask for providing an option to make Confluence go through it's spaces and include these files into generated backups.
fields.summary: Confluence does not offer including external files into daily backup
Migrate macros from org.radeox.macro.Macro to com.atlassian.renderer.v2.macro.Macro

fields.description:
When exporting links with italics or bold styles on 2.1.5 and earlier, the wiki markup for the style is not converted into the HTML equivalent. For example: Wiki Markup: [*Google*|http://www.google.com] HTML Actual: *Google*

HTML Expected: Google
fields.summary: Confluence HTML renders does not recognise styles applies to links

fields.description: change error message to say that sysadmin should create issue. Currently it just says create an issue, leading to users with no sysadmin privileges dealing with the issue.
fields.summary: Error page (500page.jsp) should suggest Confluence admin to create support case

fields.description: With the comments that go with an attachment, if you decide you want to entirely remove the comments, there isn't a way to do that. Deleting the comment field and saving has no effect, and there is no button for this purpose.
fields.summary: unable to remove attachment comment

fields.description:
The error below is thrown when you try to load a plugin containing a component wrapped into a spring transaction proxy via the web-ui.

The classloader used to load the TransactionProxyFactoryBean doesn't know about the EvaluationManager which will be loaded via the plugin classloader. Therefore the exception will be thrown. 

2006-11-14 12:40:58,602 ERROR [com.atlassian.plugin.DefaultPluginManager] addPlugin There was an error loading the descriptor 'Transactionised Evaluation Service' of plugin 'com.atlassian.confluence.extra.evaluation'. Disabling.
com.atlassian.spring.container.ComponentNotFoundException: Failed to find component: Error creating bean with name 'evaluationManager' defined in class path resource [x]: Error setting property values; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.PropertyAccessExceptionsException: PropertyAccessExceptionsException (1 errors); nested propertyAccessExceptions are: [org.springframework.beans.MethodInvocationException: Property 'proxyInterfaces' threw exception; nested exception is java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.atlassian.confluence.extra.evaluation.EvaluationManager]
	at com.atlassian.spring.container.SpringContainerContext.getComponent(SpringContainerContext.java:106)
	at com.atlassian.spring.container.ContainerManager.getComponent(ContainerManager.java:32)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.SpringComponentModuleDescriptor.enabled(SpringComponentModuleDescriptor.java:117)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.DefaultPluginManager.addPlugin(DefaultPluginManager.java:274)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.DefaultPluginManager.scanForNewPlugins(DefaultPluginManager.java:137)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.DefaultPluginManager.installPlugin(DefaultPluginManager.java:101)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:284)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:155)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:122)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:56)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:144)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:174)
	at $Proxy3.installPlugin(Unknown Source)
fields.summary: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException when plugin contains a transactionized Spring component

fields.description: Inserting custom characters using the WYSIWYG editor will render them as "?" when the page is saved and displayed.
fields.summary: Special Characters being rendered as question marks.
add optional 'labels' parameter to include page macro which associates labels from the included page with the including page

fields.description:
I am trying to create a custom authenticator, but get the following exception on startup :

java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not load security config 'null': Exception configuring from 'seraph-config.xml': 
com.atlassian.seraph.config.ConfigurationException: Could not create: authenticator: java.lang.ClassCastException: com.danisco.confluence.authenticator.DIPSSOAuthenticator
	at com.atlassian.seraph.config.SecurityConfigFactory.loadInstance(SecurityConfigFactory.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.seraph.config.SecurityConfigFactory.getInstance(SecurityConfigFactory.java:30)
	at com.atlassian.seraph.filter.SecurityFilter.init(SecurityFilter.java:47)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterConfig.getFilter(ApplicationFilterConfig.java:223)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterConfig.setFilterDef(ApplicationFilterConfig.java:304)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterConfig.<init>(ApplicationFilterConfig.java:77)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.filterStart(StandardContext.java:3598)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.start(StandardContext.java:4168)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.start(ContainerBase.java:1012)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHost.start(StandardHost.java:718)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.start(ContainerBase.java:1012)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngine.start(StandardEngine.java:442)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardService.start(StandardService.java:450)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardServer.start(StandardServer.java:700)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina.start(Catalina.java:551)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap.start(Bootstrap.java:275)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap.main(Bootstrap.java:413)

I've attached the src. ( I am extending the com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceAuthenticator as described in the documentation )

I have tried to install both under web-inf/classes and as a jar under web-inf/lib, same problem in both cases. Am I missing something here or is this a bug ?
fields.summary: ClassCastException when using custom Authenticator

fields.description:
Add a permission for anonymous users to the global administration page which prevents anonymous users from editing globally (and not let each project decide).

Right now, there is the ability to set only "Can Use" permission, we would like to have this extended.
fields.summary: Global permission to prevent anonymous users editing in any space
includebylabel macro

fields.description:
When CAPTCHA is turned on (at least when there's no exclusions), there is a bug when adding comments to a page.

The first post always fails, whether or not the text is correct.  The second post succeeds.  Adding and editing pages and news is okay, but for comments the post always has to be done twice.
fields.summary: For comments, first CAPTCHA word fails

fields.description:
If there are many users in the system (e.g. 10,000+) searching for a user is very slow. This is at least partly because every user is retrieved.

We should be able to query the underlying repository in a more sensible way.
fields.summary: Searching for users by name should not retrieve every user
Exclamation marks in image markup are incorrectly escaped if markup is not surrounded by white space

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a simple way of specifying a countdown in days/weeks/months to a specific date. This could be used on a project page to show how many days until release or some key milestone. Presumably this could be done with javascript, but it would be simpler for the user just to be able to put something like the following in wiki markup

{countdown:2006-11-30}

and have confluence convert this into (assuming the current date is 2006-11-11)

2 weeks, 5 days
fields.summary: How about a Countdown Macro for Confluence?

fields.description:
Create a page with an image on it, then create another page and use the image from the first page. This should work, but now add the {gallery} macro and the image should no longer work. See the following sample markup where A works but B doesn't:

A. !team:weekly rides^karelo_register.gif!
B. !team:weekly rides^karelo_register.gif! {gallery}

In A, the url to the image outputted is http://teamcoastal.wiki-neon.adaptavist.com/download/attachments/26/karelo_register.gif and shows fine. In B, the url to the image outputted is http://teamcoastal.wiki-neon.adaptavist.com/download/attachments/290/karelo_register.gif and doesn't. For reference, 26 is the page id of "team:weekly rides" and 290 is the page id of "team:Club Uniform" (the page with the problem).

Somehow it looks like the presence of the {gallery} macro is affecting the CEO id used in the URL ... mad!
fields.summary: Images source from other pages are broken when using the {gallery} macro

fields.description: If the version number of the attachment is amended to the filename of uploaded attachments the filename will have more meaning when the file is downloaded.
fields.summary: Amend attachment version filename with version number

fields.description: Confluence displays the date which attachments are created but not the time
fields.summary: time stamp attachments

fields.description: We should allow searches by the name of the user who created or modified content
fields.summary: Index the lastModifierName and creatorName attributes of content

fields.description: The selection page for links does not allow selection of attachments with single quotes in the name.  It just stops and does nothing.  I presume it probably has to do with JavaScript and not having it encoded correctly.  Either this page could be fixed or you may want to change to not allow attachments with quotes in them.  I will attach a screen shot.
fields.summary: The selection page for links does not allow selection of attachments with single quotes in the name.

fields.description:
The RSS feed link of a personal space has the title parameter: "getSpace().getName()"
This is not the case in 2.3
fields.summary: Feeds from Personal Spaces have broken title

fields.description:
See CSP-5793

An email with an unsupported encoding, e.g. Content-Type: text/plain; charset=unknown-8bit will cause this exception:

java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException: unknown-8bit
	at sun.io.Converters.getConverterClass(Converters.java:218)
	at sun.io.Converters.newConverter(Converters.java:251)
	at sun.io.ByteToCharConverter.getConverter(ByteToCharConverter.java:68)
	at sun.nio.cs.StreamDecoder$ConverterSD.<init>(StreamDecoder.java:224)
	at sun.nio.cs.StreamDecoder$ConverterSD.<init>(StreamDecoder.java:210)
	at



sun.nio.cs.StreamDecoder.forInputStreamReader(StreamDecoder.java:77)
	at java.io.InputStreamReader.<init>(InputStreamReader.java:83)
	at com.sun.mail.handlers.text_plain.getContent(text_plain.java:64)
	at javax.activation.DataSourceDataContentHandler.getContent(DataHandler.java:745)
	at javax.activation.DataHandler.getContent(DataHandler.java:501)
	at javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage.getContent(MimeMessage.java:1339)
	at com.atlassian.mail.MailUtils.getAttachments(MailUtils.java:147)

We should catch this exception and read the bytes of the message with message.getInputStream() and convert it to a string using some default encoding (UTF8?)
fields.summary: Unsupported character encodings in archived mail cause exceptions, should get read using ISO-8859-1 encoding

fields.description:
See CSP-5778

An LDAP connection problem causes userAccessor.getUser(user.getName()) to return a null, but unless the user checks the logs they have no idea what the problem is.
fields.summary: Better reporting of LDAP problems
UI option to list modified classes in a build

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7290].
  {panel}

Support users are frequently unaware that their Confluence instances have modified source code. 

Each startup, Confluence should run a fast check for any change to the classes and incorporate the result onto the System Information page. For example, it could use a date stamp check. 

This will make a significant improvement to technical support by catching instances where a user source modifcation is responsible for an error.

Source Code: Unmodified
Source Code: Modified By User
fields.summary: Add GUI check for source-code modification

fields.description: I tried to upgrade from our current confluence 2.1.3 to the latest stable 2.2.9. I made full backup of the our content by "Backup&Restore" tools, install the 2.2.9, when it asked about restoring, I was put the backup file in the {confluence.home}/restore directory. Size of the backup file was 1271 Mb. After page refreshing, name of the backup file appeared in the list. I selected this file and clicked "Restore".  After this I immediately got an error screen, you can find in the setup-restore-local.txt attachement.  I supposed that low memory could be the reason of this error, so I checked memory settings. It was -Xms128m -Xmx768m. I've increased initial heap up to 348m, but it doesn't help.  I've attached other logs to this issue in hope they could help to resolve the problem.
fields.summary: Can't restore backup from 2.1.3 to 2.2.9

fields.description:
editUser and setUserInfoformation don't allow you to change the username.

Username currently appears to be _the_ unique identifier for a user, whilst it is good to be unique, it is also currently impossible to change that username.
A user should have an internal unique id like the 'id' field from getUser() which ensures unique identification, which would allow for usernames to be edited.

editUser(token, UserObject)  should become   editUser(token, UserID, UserObject) this way you could allow for:

  $userobj = getUser($token, 'demouser') ;    To pull down the user info.
  $userobj[username] = "newusername" ;      To change it, and other details. e.g comment etc
  $result = editUser( $token, $userobj[id], $userobj) ;  To push up the changes, including a new username.

There would need to be checking to ensure that the new username was unique and available, this could simply throw an error if it is not usable.

setUserInformation could simlarly become setUserInformation($token, $userID, $userobj) ;

This would allow for greater flexibility for integrating Confluence user management with existing systems that might be in place.

Usernames should be changable without having to delete the user.
fields.summary: editUser and setUserInformation (XML-RPC) functions provide limited abilities

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7287].
  {panel}

Using XML-RPC/Soap (if not allowing anonymous) requires you to login, and then pass the token to each function call. This is fine for a standalone client code/script, but if you want to make use of xml-rpc in a php served web page that just needs to check that you are logged in, and pull back your username, there is no way to access the token. The login token should be available via the seraph.confluence cookie.  Also, it would be great if this cookie had a configurable path/realm so that you can choose to expose it to the rest of your site.

e.g. If I have a site as  http://mywebspace/. and confluence is setup as  http://mywebspace/wiki/  then the cookie will only be pathed to /wiki and not /

There appears to be no ability to configu to expose the confluence user session cookie data to a larger cookie realm. This would be nice as it would allow for development off a single-sign-on environment where the core of that SSO is confluence's existing session management.

In the past there was a bug fix to restrict the cookie path to the context path of confluence to ensure that the cookies don't colide with JIRA and other Seraph authenticating web applications. This was a good fix, but it's ultimatly removed the ability to pass the cookie to a PHP coded page, that could decode the cookie, get the authentication token, and use that via the XML-RPC or Soap Remote API to perform tasks knowing the use it logged in.

There are plenty of examples on writting my own single sign on code, but why go to that effort when the framwork is in place within confluence itself, I just need to be able to talk to it.

I'd like to see the authentication token, stored into the cookie, to be able to configure the cookie to default to the context path, but allow for this to be set as '/'. 

Unless there is a way to configure this, but it's just buried somewhere in the config files. I haven't had much success finding it as yet.

Any ideas, could the previous bug fixes be modified to make it a little more admin-configurable?
fields.summary: Configurable cookie path for seraph.confluence cookies to allow use of sessions in external apps.

fields.description: When these feeds are put in an RSS reader they return no posts.
fields.summary: RSS Feeds listed under the Advanced > RSS Feeds section don't work

fields.description: When an attachment (that contains several historical versions) is moved to another page, all authors of previous versions are set to the person who moved the attachment.
fields.summary: Moving attachment to another page clobbers authors of previous versions

fields.description:
I am attempting to upgrade Confluence 1.4.4 to 2.2.9.

We have a large confluence installation with > 100,000 pages.

I cannot do a complete backup/or restore so I have been attempting to export individual Spaces. However any page which has been restricted ( plus any children of that page ) is not exported.

I have checked the export file and the page has not been exported into the file.

It seems possible that the export honours the permissioning model and disregards the fact that I am the administrator.
fields.summary: Space export does not export restricted pages.

fields.description:
I added a bunch of users using xmlrpc, a number of those didn't have fullname set. After a few days one of those users created a personal space: this user's space was created with SPACENAME set to NULL which caused parts of Confluence to barf with java.lang.NullPointerException errors. I guess the AddPersonalSpace should check if the user's fullname is set or not before adding the space ;-)

(I fixed it by hand in the database by setting the Space's name to the user's fullname using "update SPACES set SPACENAME='<fulname>' where SPACEID=57;")
fields.summary: "Create Personal Space" can create Space with NULL name

fields.description:
When storing pages using XMLRPC method storePage() the fields creator, created, modifier, modified appear to be ignored. 
All content will be stored as belonging to the account used for xmlrpc. 

I'd like to be able to set these fields so I can do wiki/content conversion and maintain all the timestamps/user revisions. Maybe I'm sending these fields in a wrong format, but according to the debug log it appears to be ok. See attachments for a perl script that reproduces this issue and a log of the xmlrpc conversation.
fields.summary: XMLRPC API storePage ignores 'creator', 'created', 'modifier', 'modified' fields

fields.description:
Korean text in MS Word, Excel and PDF documents can be searched fine. 

However, korean text in powerpoint files cannot.
fields.summary: Powerpoint files containing korean characters cannot be searched
Upgrade project dependencies to use XStream 1.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7277].
  {panel}

Logging - 

1) How can we track and log user account activities? Activities include last login, inactivity, successful and unsuccessful log-in actions and attempts. 
For user account activity we want to be able to track this user login information from an administrative console, account, log file or application so the response "Last login is already recorded. A user can view their last login date by going to their user preferences page" is not what we are looking for. 

2) How can we track and log authenticated HTTP access requests? Since Confluence does not use HTTP BASIC authentication there is no record in the access log of what authenticated user is associated with an individual HTTP request.   For logging in general we need an understanding of all the logging options for Confluence which can produce log records. 

3) How can we lock out users after three unsuccessful login attempts (i.e. brute force attack)? 

4) How can we apply password policy controls (expiration, minimum length, re-use,...)? 

For life cycle management, I have included two examples in which meta-tags were used. 
  
Example 1 - what we used for the policy driven lifecycle meta-tags in HTML pages 

  <meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1"> 
   <meta name="title" content="Apache Web Server"> 
   <meta name="description" content="Apache Web Server"> 
   <meta name="creator" content="John P. Dodge"> 
   <meta name="owner" content="John P. Dodge"> 
   <meta name="date" content="2006-10-20"> 
   <meta name="validuntil" content="2009-10-20"> 
   <meta name="generator" content="mk-metas/0.9"> 
   <meta name="robots" content="all"> 
   <meta name="GENERATOR" content="Mozilla/4.79 [en] (X11; U; SunOS 5.8 sun4u) [Netscape]"> 
   <meta name="subject" content="Apache Web Server"> 
   <meta name="Modified-Date" content="2006-10-20"> 
   <meta name="Identification" content="Apache Web Server"> 
   <meta name="Created-Date" content="1997-1-31"> 
   <meta name="Storage" content="Share Server"> 
   <meta name="Retrieval" content="Electronically"> 
   <meta name="Protection" content="Password access"> 
   <meta name="Retention" content="Life of product"> 
   <meta name="Disposition" content="Electronically deleted"> 


Another Example: 

<head> 
<title>ISO - NISO Main Website</title> 
<meta name="Creator" content="Joan Elmquist"> 
<meta name="Owner" CONTENT="Joan Elmquist">

fields.summary: Logging and Life Cycle Management
Allow the entry of no password and username for jtds when using windows domain authentication

fields.description:
http://feedvalidator.org/check.cgi?url=http%3A%2F%2Fconfluence.atlassian.com%2Fcreaterssfeed.action%3Ftypes%3Dpage%26statuses%3Dcreated%26statuses%3Dmodified%26spaces%3DDOC%26labelString%3D%26rssType%3Datom%26maxResults%3D10%26timeSpan%3D5%26publicFeed%3Dtrue%26title%3DConfluence%2BRSS%2BFeed

Missing: 
* feed:updated
* entry:id
* entry:updated

Broken:
* feed:id (it's just the base Confluence URL for every feed, useless)

No entry IDs? I mean, that's not even trying! There should be nothing stopping you using the Tag URI scheme here if you're desperate.
fields.summary: Atom feeds are totally invalid

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7274].
  {panel}

The ability to disable Browse and Search in a given space, will allow creating wiki-islands incubator-type spaces. Such 'island' pages (isolated wiki pages with no visibility into the space beyond/no birds-eye view on the wiki) can be shared within a team/community/group of users (by sharing the URL) without having to share the whole space with everyone at once/the same time (unlike personal space pages).  Rely on word-of-mouth interlinking to other pages in the space, for making pages accessible from each other only within some kind of context (vs. cold search results).  

Benefits:
- Allows topics to emerge on one or more related pages ('islands') before moving out of the incubator into a relevant "traditional" (and searchable) team space.
- Encourages interlinking between pages which are related (results in better inter-page browseability and provides more metadata for search relevance and "related pages" functionality - once the content moves to a searchable space).
- Encourages using red (undefined) links to first map out future related/children pages (i.e. top-down mental process).
- Allows unrelated pages to remain invisible to each other within the same space, in turn allowing to share a page (and those it links to) without necessarily sharing the whole space.  This can also reduce the overall number of spaces required.

Of course Space admins would still have god-like browse and search access to everything, and 'Browse & Search' would be ON by default to keep current standard behavior.

I know it sounds contrary to wiki philosophy to wish to restrict page browsing (i.e. content discovery) but as mentioned above, it can make sense in some cases.

Note: Comparable functionality is available in Picasa Web albums: one can elect to make a photo gallery public (visible on the user's public gallery index page) or private (gallery still publicly accessible without logging in, but URL obfuscated so it's hard to guess and virtually impossible to randomly discover).  The key is obscurity (content hard to find unless you've received a link to it), not restriction (i.e. read/write permissioning unaffected).
fields.summary: Allow unsearchable and unlisted (yet not readprotected) spaces

fields.description:
Inserting a Link in standard URL syntax only works if the protocol is known by Confluence. We rely heavily on different protocols for accessing internal systems.

Example:
alienbrain://path/to/my/file

Usually the operating system hooks into these url's and resolves them correctly to the pertinent client. It's a shame it does not work with Confluence.
fields.summary: URL parsing does not work as expected
Being able to see the content you have added with a "see my posts" link

fields.description:
Updating a blog post through the remote API doesn't save the history correctly.

It looks like the problem is cause in the com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.soap.services.BlogSopaService -> updateBlog(RemoteBlogEntry remoteBlogEntry) where the pageManager.saveContentEntity(blogPost, null); method is called insted of the three parameter version
fields.summary: Update blog post remotely doesn't save history

fields.summary: IllegalArgumentException when creating space export after session timeout

fields.description: This issue covers any unexpected behaviour such as stack traces resulting from page operations performed after user session has timed out. At present, the fix for these issues is to check the 'Remember My Login' option, enable cookies in your browser, and manually logout when required.
fields.summary: Umbrella issue for errors caused by session timeouts

fields.description:
I am using the jiraissues macro in confluence and I want to see the time tracking fields timeoriginalestimate, timeestimate, timespent, but they are not supported according to the following page 

 http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF20/JIRA+Issues+Macro
fields.summary: jira issues macro column support for the time tracking fields

fields.description:
Many times I want to create a page, mess around with it, and then when I'm done send out an email that the page has been created.  Right now there is no way of creating a page without sending out a notification.

This is probably a simple thing to add since you already have a checkbox when you edit a page.
fields.summary: Enable no notification mail on page creation

fields.description:
{column:width=200px} is currently outputting <td class="confluenceTd"  valign="top" width="200px%">

It seems to be blindly assuming the width is a percentage ... it should only add "%" if width is an number (possibly a decimal).
fields.summary: Functionality regression with {column}

fields.description:
Clicking on a Confluence document link without being logged in causes a 
redirect to the dashboard. I have to click the link again after logging 
in. This can be quite confusing to non Confluence savvy users.
fields.summary: Confluence document link without being logged in redirects to the dashboard

fields.description:
{noformat}
Very simple task, but without some obvious solution:

In WikiMarkup editor, is there any way to type "\\" in the middle of a sentence? For example, what should I type to get:

My name is \\peter\\.

Even when you use RichTextEditor and type in this sentence, Confluence pretends to be smart and produces funny results. Switch several times from WikiMarkup to RTE back and forth and the results are even funnier.

OK, I know that "\\" stands for line break. But I don't want a line break, I just want plain vanilla backslashes (don't ask why is this so important to me). I have tried with "\\\", "\\\\", ended with "\\\\\\\\"... without desired result.

Some other simple text constructs are also tricky. What should I type into the RTE or WME to get:

My name is {{peter}}.

Don't try (in WME):

... \{\{peter\}\}

'cause it does not work. And RTE does not help with this. In fact, it looks like RTE works like "what you see is what you get... almost".
{noformat}
fields.summary: Can't escape double-backslash (like '\\') in wiki markup editor
Ability to specify maximum number of attachment versions and expiry date (Attachment Archive Control)
Add administrator ability to monitor attachment statistics by user

fields.description: Should include option for maximum file size, maximum attachment size per space, maximum attachment file size per page.
fields.summary: Allow configuration of maximum attachment sizes per space or per page
Microsoft Communicator Presence Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7256].
  {panel}

Feedback from a customer:

You use a number of access keys in your web pages.  A number of them interfere with my normal keys (emacs ctrl commands, if you know what that means).  This is especially a problem in the "edit" mode of a page.

Perhaps you can provide a user profile option to disable access keys.  It would help A LOT to make your product more usable.

Thanks

Mac OSX/Safari
fields.summary: Disable Access Keys

fields.description: A request for additional presence macros
fields.summary: Sametime (lotusnotes IM) presence macro
View attachments in a space hierarchically (in the same way the pages are organized)

fields.description:
This bug occurs when using {metadata-list} tags around a table, which contains a {footnote} in the header column (the left one) that contains above a certain amount of text. 

Here's some text you can put into a new page which will cause the error:

{metadata-list}
|| Name {footnote}Here's some text that will cause a System Error once it gets too long. Here's some text that will cause a System Error once it gets too long. Here's some text that will cause a System Error once it gets too long. Here's some text that will cause a System Error once it gets too long.{footnote} |  |
{metadata-list}

When you go to preview the page it won't preview (it just stays on the markup page) and when you save it it goes to the System Error page. If you take out half the text from the footnote it works fine.

The error page including Stack Trace is attached.
fields.summary: Use of {footnote} containing lots of text within {metadata-list} causes a System Error

fields.description:
The #pluginStylesheet macro doesn't accept a spaceKey parameter, so the StylesheetAction never sets the appropriate space colour scheme.

Add a new macro, #pluginSpaceStylesheet that takes a spaceKey and will use the space colour scheme if it exists.
fields.summary: Plugins need to link stylesheet manually if space-specific colour scheme is to be used
SQL Macro adds extraneous javascript to PDF export

fields.description: Confluence should be able to search on more than one membership attribute
fields.summary: LDAP integration support for multiple membership attributes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7247].
{panel}
I would like to have a GUI way of changing the author of a page (or set of pages). Often we import a bunch of pages, but the author needs to be changed to another user. Or an existing author leaves and we need to re-assign a document.
h3. Workaround

Please see this article for detailed instructions: [How to change the creator of a page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+change+the+creator+of+a+page]
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of February 2, 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all, 


 Thank you for your votes and comments on this suggestion. I'm sorry we haven't provided you with an update in such a long time.


 We understand that for many of you, there is a close correlation between author and page ownership. With that in mind, we unfortunately don’t see ourselves working on this issue within the near future, but do have a several workarounds for the issues you’ve described:


 1. Displaying a page owner - we recommend using an info macro or table labelled “page owner” and tagging the relevant user. For more complex applications, Comala Workflows offers alternative solutions.
 2. Deleting a previous employee's account (which is tied to existing pages) - we do not recommend you delete users from Confluence, as that would complicate your database (e.g. deletion of the user’s previous comments) but you can[ deactivate previous user accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/delete-or-disable-users-138318.html] for security purposes and still keep track of the pages they’ve worked on. Deactivating a user ensures they no longer count towards your license tier.
 3. Redirecting notifications to the page owner - notifications are handled through watching the page. If you no longer want to receive notifications, you can unwatch the page and have the new page owner start watching it to receive the relevant notifications.
 4. Finally, you can also change a page creator through the database. We recommend retaining an instance of your previous DB and doing this with a DBA present.


We’ll be revisiting this suggestion in around a year, and reconsidering the request.


 Best,
 Jenny Millman | Product Manager, Confluence Server
{panel}
fields.summary: Ability to change the author of an existing page

fields.description: I often find myself wanting to show someone else the changes that were made between versions of a doc.  It would be nice to have a 'link to comparison' link on the comparison page.  This link could be sent to someone else for direct access to the comparison page.
fields.summary: Ability to link to version changes page for arbitrary versions

fields.description:
[some text:text]-[some text:text]-[some text:text]
 
Wiki Markup view should be:
 "\[some text:text\]\-\[some text:text\]\-\[some text:text\]"
 
Preview or Save result
"\[some text:text\]-\[some text:text\]-\[some text:text\]"

 (all the "\"s in front of "-"s are removed).
fields.summary: Hyphen is not escaped when switching between RT and Wiki, causes strikethrough

fields.description:
The nightly backups are a very important part of ensuring that critical information is not lost.  Therefore, it is very important for the confluence instance administrator to be aware of problems when they happen, particularly problems with the backup process.

It would be great if an email were sent to the administrator if the daily backup failed.  An alternative / additional notification could be a message presented to the use upon login.
fields.summary: Actively notify the administrator if the daily backup fails.

fields.description:
To replicate:

1. Type something such that it will fill the WYSIWYG editing window. Alternatively, edit a long page
2. Type something
3. Undo
fields.summary: Page and Caret scrolls to the top of the page when you 'undo', either by Ctrl-Z or the undo button

fields.description:
The root name is hardcoded to be the domain name only. Hence, accessing the IP won't work.  

liveSearchRoot = "$bootstrap.domainName";

testing on my local machine
http://localhost:8080/plugins/livesearch/livesearch.action            OK

http:// <IP address>:8080/plugins/livesearch/livesearch.action      can't establish a connection to the server at <IP address>:8080.

the same for CAC

Fix: java script should determine where the request was made from and allow to access the IP and the domain name
fields.summary: Livesearch macro bind to the hardcoded domain name only
Ability to change order of Favourites/Labels
Excerpt macro documentation needs to describe rendering limitations
Include file name of exported pages on page footer
Improve file names for exported pages by making them more meaningful
Mandatory fields in page templates

fields.description:
When importing text files using the "Import Pages from Disk" option in Space Admin, the pages are read from disk using a FileReader with the default Java encoding.

This can be overridden through the system property 'file.encoding', but really we should have an option on the page to select the encoding used in the files to be imported.
fields.summary: Select encoding when importing text files
Optionally include changes to personal spaces into the daily changes email

fields.description:
I am having troubles regarding user validation:

The users in our AD are in two subtrees of the LDAP server,
OU=usersubou1,OU=users,DC=mytree
and
OU=usersubou2,OU=users,DC=mytree
The base user namespace is OU=users,DC=mytree , userSearchAllDepth is true.

All users are found and shown correctly on the admin interface.
Users from OU=usersubou1 can login successfully.
Users from OU=usersubou2 cannot login (a message is displayed that the user is not found or the password is incorrect).

The log file shows the following line when a user from usersubou2 tries to login:

2006-10-30 16:10:57,939 ERROR [ldap.security.authentication.DefaultLDAPAuthenticator] authenticate Could not authenticate with LDAP. Please check your host ('ldap://myadir.uibk.ac.at:389'), bind DN ('CN=testuser,OU=usersubou1,OU=users,DC=mytree') or bind password are correct.

So Confluence tries usersubou1 instead of usersubou2 for the user.

We previousely had problems with LDAP validation, therefore we are using atlassian-user-2006-10-11.jar (see bug CONF-7117)

I am attaching a (modified) atlassian-user.xml.


Thanks,
Michael
fields.summary: LDAP user searched in the wrong tree

fields.description:
On extranet, created a new page (JIRADEV:Shareable Dashboards) and labeled with 'specification'. Searching for items labeled 'specification' turns up all 6 entries (including teh new page).

The JIRADEV:BrainStorming page uses the contentbylabel macro for label 'specification'. However the new page does not appear in the list.
fields.summary: contentbylabel does not pick up new entries

fields.description:
This email was recieved from Ronald Schwarz

> The PDF is 4 MB. I made a table of defective pages to accompany the PDF. 
> I believe you should see the wiki markup of the pages in the CosmoCom 
> Confluence site to understand the problems.
> 
>  
>   *Pages*  *Problem*
>   All  Pages are produced in A4 size.  Need letter size for American 
> market.
>   7-19  Indented link entries in Table  of Contents (manually generated) 
> appear in separate  boxes.
>   25-30  Table columns are of equal  size. In Confluence the sizes are 
> unequal because the columns fit the  contents - this is how they should 
> appear in the PDF. Long text strings overlap  table boundaries. Code 
> text overlaps code macro  boundaries (used indent macros).
>   62-68  There is a pseudo table  effect: Items in code macros are 
> boxed. Text items look like table cells  printed only the right half of 
> each cell.
>   75-78  Text strings extend beyond  table and page boundaries. Text 
> string extends beyond  code macro.
>   88  See  Conf-7175.
>   89  Long string overruns page  boundary.
>   108-109  Right side boundary of code  macro coincides with right side 
> boundary of important note. (In confluence  the code is entirely and 
> symmetrically enclosed in the  note.)
>   225-226  The table is illegible. Column  two text overlaps column 
> three text.
>   289-291  Code text overlaps right side  boundary.
>   292-294  Text following the CIF and  QCIF headings should not be in 
> boxes. There is an XML problem on page 293:  an extra bullet appears.
>   328-329  Table row is split across  pages.
>   368  XML problem: two extra bullets  appear.
>   405-406  Bulleted text in table appears  in boxes.
>   489  The footnote looks like a row  of a two column table.
>
fields.summary: Various improvements to PDF export
Apply Button for Confluence Edit Screen
Advanced Search - Search only certain spaces
